case_title: NAZAR MUHAMMAD Etc vs SULTAN AHMAD Etc

accussed_details.name: Nazar Muhammad Etc
allegation: Challenging bifurcation of wandas and consolidation scheme

accussed_details.name: Sultan Ahmad Etc
allegation: Claiming entitlement to separate wandas due to lapse of mortgage period

complaint_summary: Petitioners challenged the bifurcation of wandas and consolidation scheme, claiming respondents lacked proprietary rights and locus standi.
investigation_summary: Consolidation scheme confirmed in 1985; respondents claimed entitlement to separate wandas due to lapse of 60-year mortgage period.

findings: Sixty years had lapsed, respondents assumed status of right-holders.
Petitioners legally barred from redemption under Section 3 of the Redemption and Restitution of Mortgaged Lands Act 1964.
Separate wandas and physical possession of land granted to respondents.
judgment_summary.final_decision: Revisions rejected, respondents entitled to separate wandas and physical possession.

Decision_or_verdict: Order dismissed; respondents entitled to separate wandas and physical possession of mortgaged land.

contentions: Respondents as mortgagees were not entitled to proprietary rights.
Delay in appeal was unlawfully condoned.
Civil suit filed by respondents was dismissed.
Joint wanda cannot be partitioned without consent of co-sharers.
Sixty years had lapsed, mortgaged land matured into ownership.
Petitioners failed to redeem the land within the legal timeframe.

statutes: Redemption and Restitution of Mortgaged Lands Act 1964
sections: Section 13 of Consolidation of Holdings Ordinance 1960
Section 3 of Redemption and Restitution of Mortgaged Lands Act 1964

witness_statement.Munshi Muhammad: Produced relevant record and connected documents.
witness_statement.Patwari: Examined consolidation entries and land records.

appeal_details.collector_decision: Bifurcation and preparation of separate wandas for Sultan Ahmad Etc

revision_details.decision: Separate wandas for Sultan Ahmad Etc, no change in possession until court decision

key_issues: Entitlement to separate wandas after lapse of mortgage period
Validity of bifurcation orders by lower courts

maxims.PLD 1966 S.C. 267: Once a mortgage has been created, it remains in existence until terminated by law or agreement, and unredeemed mortgages mature into ownership after the limitation period.

legal_terms.Wanda: Partitioned share of land in consolidation proceedings.
legal_terms.Mortgagee: Entity holding rights to mortgaged property.

words_and_phrases.Jamabandi zer-i-kar: Land revenue record used in consolidation proceedings.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the entitlement of respondents to separate wandas after the lapse of a 60-year mortgage period. Petitioners challenged the bifurcation orders, citing lack of proprietary rights for respondents. The court upheld respondents' claims under Section 3 of the Redemption and Restitution of Mortgaged Lands Act 1964, dismissing the revisions and confirming respondents' ownership and physical possession of the land.
